title: 107_hr3285
content: The Act titled "Federal-Local Information Sharing Partnership Act of 2001" allows for the sharing of grand jury information. Rule 6(e)(3)(C) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure is amended to allow sharing of grand jury information with law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision. The amendment allows sharing of grand jury information with State or political subdivision law enforcement personnel, who must use the information in accordance with guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 3. AUTHORITY TO SHARE ELECTRONIC, WIRE, AND ORAL INTERCEPTION INFORMATION. Section 2517(6) of title 18, United States Code is amended to allow sharing of interception information with law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision, with guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 4. FOREIGN INTELLIGENCE INFORMATION. Section 203(d)(1) of the USA PATRIOT ACT is amended to allow law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision to receive and use national security information. The USA PATRIOT ACT is amended to allow State law enforcement personnel to receive and use national security information, with guidelines issued by the Attorney General for confidentiality. SEC. 5. DISCLOSURES TO GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES FOR COUNTERTERRORISM PURPOSES. Section 626(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act is amended to allow disclosure of consumer report information to law enforcement personnel for official duties. Law enforcement personnel must use the information in accordance with guidelines issued by the Attorney General. Section 222(f) of the Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to allow the Secretary of State to provide records related to visas or permits to law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision for official purposes. The Secretary of State can provide visa or permit records to State law enforcement personnel if deemed necessary, with guidelines from the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 7 amends the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act to include state law enforcement personnel in information acquisition. SEC. 8 pertains to information obtained from physical searches. SEC. 8 amends the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act to include state law enforcement personnel in information acquisition from physical searches. Section 444(j)(1)(B) of the General Education Provisions Act is amended to allow disclosure of education records to state law enforcement personnel, with guidelines on information use. SEC. 10. INVESTIGATION AND PROSECUTION OF TERRORISM. Section 408(c)(1)(B) of the National Education Statistics Act of 1994 is amended to allow disclosure of reports, records, and information to law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision for official duties. Any recipient of information must use it in accordance with guidelines.
